intro: Uvifera microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved uvifera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Uvifera microphylla is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
